Material used.Description: Transfection of wild-type and Gly2385Arg LRRK2 proteins into human cell lines.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Increased toxicity and apoptosis under oxidative stress
Readout description.Result Description: The Gly2385Arg variant showed increased localization to the cytoplasm, aggregate formation, and higher rates of apoptosis compared to wild-type under oxidative stress conditions.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple biological replicates were performed as part of the study.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated multiple times to ensure consistency in results.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 protein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Possibly an empty vector or non-transfected cells were used as negative controls, though not explicitly stated.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Multivariate logistic regression was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein localization and aggregate formation similar to wild-type under control conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased apoptosis rates compared to wild-type under oxidative stress.

Approved assay.Description: Functional studies and transfection assays are commonly used methods in studying gene function related to neurodegenerative diseases.
